physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman, framing only her torso and head. The photograph is taken from the side. The woman is looking down towards the camera. She is dressed in a striped top, and is wearing a pair of glasses. In the background of the photograph, there is a canopy of a tree seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver  taken from side angle
